After 3 days of skin lesion, macrophages are the predominant immune cells found at the wound site. In the wound, macrophages remove dead cells and secrete many cytokines and growth factors that regulate the proliferative phase to stimulate migration, proliferation and differentiation of fibroblasts, keratinocytes and endothelial cells
29 . In the remodeling phase, macrophages can release enzymes that alter the composition of the extracellular matrix (ECM) and the structure of the wound bed
29 .
